document_data.name: Zorbo
document_data.mainbody: '''Zorbos''' ({{Pronounce|ZOR|bohz|refs=}}) were small, carnivorous creatures native to [[Chult]].
document_data.Description:
Zorbos were typically around three feet tall, and covered in gray fur. They had sharp teeth, as well as sharp claws on both hands and feet.

Within [[Shou Lung]], a variety of zorbo that resembled [[panda]]s was known.
document_data.Behavior: They favored [[human]] meat, but were also known to enjoy the meat of [[dwarf|dwarves]], [[elf|elves]], [[gnome]]s, and [[halfling]]s.
document_data.Combat: In combat, zorbos had the unusual ability to draw on their surroundings to make themselves tougher. For example, a zorbo fighting inside a cave could draw upon the aspects of stone. Additionally, zorbos could absorb the protective features of armor and magical items. If such an item were hit by a zorbo, it would dissolve into dust.
document_data.Ecology: Zorbos were most often found in groups of one to four individuals. and as many as a dozen zorbos could live in a single wukka tree.
document_data.Notable zorbos: *[[Obo'laka]], one of the [[Primal_spirit#The_Nine_Trickster_Gods_of_Chult|Nine Trickster Gods]] of Chult, was a zorbo.
